-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Regulary, content is always related to the current server, only. In some special cases, you might want to override this to show content from another server.
The ID value of the server to whome the content is related
By default, the address (e. g.) "/content.aspx" provides different content on different servers. So, the intranet and the extranet are able to show independent content. In some cases, you might want to override this behaviour and you want to show on the same URL the same content in the extranet as well as in the intranet. In this case, you would setup this property on the extranet server's scripts to show the content of the intranet server.

[adminsupport] 02.02.2006 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Data is maintained for every language/market separately; when there is no value for a market it will be searched for some compatible language data
Example: When the visitor is in market "German/Austria" but there is only some content available for market "German", the German data will be used. If the lookup process fails, an HTTP error 404 will be returned to the browser.
[adminsupport] 02.02.2006 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Data is maintained for every language/market separately; when there is no value for the current market, the sWCMS control tries to lookup a best matching content
When the user requests a page in e. g. market 559 ("French/France"), there will be the following order for the lookup process:
Current market, in ex. ID 559 / French/France
Current language of market, in ex. ID 3 / French
English universal, ID 1
Worldwide market, ID 10000
International, ID 0
If the lookup process fails, an HTTP error 404 will be returned to the browser.
[adminsupport] 02.02.2006 Created

----------------------------------------------------------------------------- Project : camm WebManager Class : camm.WebManager.Modules.WebEdit.Controls.SmartWcms
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The smart and built-in content management system of camm Web-Manager
This page contains a web editor which saves/load the content to/from the CWM database. The editor will only be visible for those people with appropriate authorization. All other people will only see the content, but nothing to modify it. The content may be different for languages or markets. In all cases, there will be a version history. When there is no content for an URL in the database - or it hasn't been released - the page request will lead to an HTTP 404 error code.
[adminsupport] 29.11.2005 Created

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Lookup the real IP address of the remote client in a current HttpContext
A remote IP address of the client behind a reverse proxy
In case that there is a reverse proxy which forwards all incoming requests to your web-server, the regularily reported remote IP address is the one of the reverse proxy. But sometimes you'll need the IP address of the real client.
This method analyzes the request headers and if the reverse proxy reports the client IP, it will be returned instead of normal remote IP.
[adminwezel] 17.08.2007 Created

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Is the IPv4 address a host of a specified address range?
An IPv4 host address An array of strings defining address ranges, e. g. 192.168.*
This method compares the string content and not the byte content, that's why you should not forget the leading dot in front of the star in your IP address range.
These address ranges would be fine:
10.*
192.168.*
Those address ranges could get misinterpreted:
10* (would also accept 101.*, 102.*, etc. and invalid IP addresses like 10:ZZ:*)
192.168.*.* (all letters after the first star will be ignored)

member.param: The file path for the output
member.remarks: An existing file will be overwritten

member.name: M:CompuMaster.camm.WebManager.Utils.CreateObject(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Create an instance of an object which is defined by assembly name and class name
member.returns: The created instance of the requested
member.remarks:
The loading procedure is in following order:
Assemblies already loaded into the current application domain
Assembly loaded from disc (with standard search order in application folder, GAC, etc.)
member.exception: If the object can't be created or the assembly can't be loaded, there will be a System.Exception

member.name: M:CompuMaster.camm.WebManager.Utils.CreateObject(System.String,System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Create an instance of an object which is defined by assembly name and class name
member.param: An assembly name which is already loaded into the current application domain (e.g. "System.Data")
Parameters for the constructor of the new class instance
member.returns: The created instance of the requested
member.remarks:
The loading procedure is in following order:
Assemblies already loaded into the current application domain
Assembly loaded from disc (with standard search order in application folder, GAC, etc.)
member.exception: If the object can't be created or the assembly can't be loaded, there will be a System.Exception

----------------------------------------------------------------------------- Project : camm WebManager Class : camm.WebManager.Pages.Specialized.FeedbackForm
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
A feedback form always requires some logic to collect user inputs and to send them via e-mail to a defined address.
Only server control data (web controls, html controls) will be collected, but no normal HTML input tags which are not running at server.
The controls can be placed by you yourself. If they contain user input data, it will be added to the collected data list.
You only should ensure that you also create a Button or LinkButton which calls the method CollectDataAndSendEMail to collect and send the data.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------- Project : camm WebManager Class : camm.WebManager.Pages.ProtectedPage
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
A protected page which requires an access validation
If the security object name hasn't been set via the property cammWebManager.SecurityObject and it also hasn't been validated by performing an access check, this page will throw an exception in Render event. The security objects "Anonymous" or "@@Anonymous" would be accepted also when they allow access to everybody. This is okay since it is ensured by the non-empty string that the developer hasn't forgotten to add a security object check to his page.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------- Project : camm WebManager Class : camm.WebManager.Application.HttpApplication
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
An HttpApplication handler of camm Web-Manager for the handling of thrown exceptions
To use the camm Web-Manager in the application context, you should have configured the most important things in your web.config - even if you have configured all settings in your /sysdata/config.vb file. camm Web-Manager will take all settings from the web.config file of your web application. The required ones or the important ones for this HttpApplication class are:
WebManager.ConnectionString
WebManager.SMTPServerName
WebManager.StandardEMailAccountAddress
WebManager.DevelopmentEMailAccountAddress
WebManager.TechnicalServiceEMailAccountName
WebManager.TechnicalServiceEMailAccountAddress
WebManager.NotifyOnApplicationExceptions (only if you want to change the default)

----------------------------------------------------------------------------- Project : camm WebManager Class : camm.WebManager.DownloadHandler
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The download handler provides mechanisms for creating temporary files with automatic removal after they're not required any more. If collection contains only single file, then download handler creates hard link for that file in the download location. In case there is error while creating hard link the download handler copies the file to download location. For all other possible collection, download handler archives the download collection to zip format and put this zip archive in download location.
The features are that
The application only has to create those temporary files once and the next requests can use a cached file
All browsers are correctly handling the name of file because the downloaded file doesn't rely on a download script file with parameters in the URL respecitvely a file name or MIME type in the headers of the response (which is not always interpreted correctly by the different browsers/platforms)
Compression of files by providing ZIP archives
Multiple files can be downloaded in a ZIP file
High performance downloads inclusive multiple-stream and continue-aborted-downloads support since IIS can handle the file transfer itself
This makes sense especially in following situations:
Download of files from a database
Download of files which are stored in the local or a network file system but which are not available directly through the webserver
Download of several files (e. g. from a download cart)
Download of large files which would require the ASP.NET engine to hold a lot of memory as long as the request has been processed completely
Construction of the complete path: IISWebRoot/SystemDownloadFolderForTemporaryFiles/{ResolveSubFolderFromDownloadLocation}/pathInDownloadLocation/folderInVirtualDownloadLocation/FileName.Extension IISWebRoot/SystemDownloadFolderForTemporaryFiles/{ResolveSubFolderFromDownloadLocation}/pathInDownloadLocation/zipFile.zip[/folderInVirtualDownloadLocation/FileName.Extension]
[adminwezel] 20.07.2004 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

[patil] 31.01.2005 Created

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Application classes, pages, controls and modules of camm Web-Manager
The basic API of camm Web-Manager is implemented in CompuMaster.camm.WebManager.WMSystem. Every cammWebManager object on your page will provide these interfaces. The recommendation is to use CompuMaster.camm.WebManager.Pages.Page instead of the normal System.Web.UI.Page if you like to access the cammWebManager property from your code-behind source code.
For a fully functional camm Web-Manager, your webserver's user account needs write access to following directories
/sysdata/ for a working web editor in your website's editorial, copyright and data protection page
/system/downloads/ for a fully featured download handler which provides advanced technologies to provide dynamic download files
[wezel] 29.01.2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

All e-mails will be redirected to the developer; no e-mail will be sent to the origin receipient. This is optimal for project development and testing environments.
The messages will be sent to the developer contact configured in your config files.

member.name: F:CompuMaster.camm.WebManager.WMSystem.DebugLevels.Max_RedirectPageRequestsManually
member.summary: Maximum debug level - never use in production environments!

remarks.para: ATTENTION: Never use this mode in production environments!
All e-mails will be redirected to the developer; no e-mail will be sent to the origin receipient. This is optimal for setting up the project.
The messages will be sent to the developer contact configured in your config files.
Automatic redirects have to be manually executed. This is ideally for solving redirection bugs or when loosing session paths in cookieless scenarios.

member.name: T:CompuMaster.camm.WebManager.WMSystem.DebugLevels
member.summary: Existing debug levels in camm Web-Manager

member.name: F:CompuMaster.camm.WebManager.WMSystem.SpecialGroups.Group_Supervisors
member.summary: Supervisors
member.remarks: A supervisor has got all authorizations, sees everthing, can do everything.

member.name: F:CompuMaster.camm.WebManager.WMSystem.SpecialGroups.Group_SecurityAdministrators
member.summary: Security administrators

remarks.para: Security administrators manage the incoming account creation notifications, assign authorizations, trouble shoot users with their problems.
The possibilities to manage authorizations, etc. are defined by the delegation of security authorizations.

The security administrator gets a notification when a user account has been created. So, he's able to authorize the new user for all applications, the security administrator is responsible for assignments.

list.item: Security Master (available only in applications overview or users overview)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If the authorization of the current user to the current security object is checked by camm Web-Manager automatisms, how shall the page access be logged?
As soon as you set up a value for property SecurityObject, camm Web-Manager automatically checks if the current user is really authorized to access this security object. By default, all security validations will be handled as a page access in the log analysis. In some cases, it may be useful to not log every access as a hit. For this, you can setup the required behaviour regarding the logging of hits.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The server address as it shall be/has been used by the client
In most cases, this Uri is the same as in HttpContext.Current.Request.Url, but there might be some situations, where it's different. When you use a forwarding proxy (e. g. with Apache), the proxy might be configured to the IP address instead of the origin server name because the origin server name has been resolved to your forwarding proxy server. This situation is sometimes used for Intranets, when your firewall configuration doesn't allow a direct access to the genuine webserver. So, this method replaces the host name by the value provided by the HTTP_X_FORWARDED_HOST server variable which will be added by the forwarding proxy server.

Retrieve the session ID of the current script engine on the current server from the camm Web-Manager session
The login name of a user A script engine ID A string with the complete session ID
Sometimes it happens that a user has logged on, but the server cannot identify the user again by the session ID of the current server. For example the virtual Microsoft IIS web server has been divided into several applications. Each application tracks its own session information. The one application wouldn't know anything about choosen language, logged on users, etc. In this situation, camm Web-Manager can try to detect the correct session ID and recreate all necessary basic information in this separate session store.

A maximum of 10 notification e-mails per 10 minutes has been set.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Configures the authentication methods for the SMTP server
The authentification type, possible values are "" or "NONE", "LOGIN", "PLAIN", "CRAM-MD5", or "NTLM"
[adminsupport] 16.10.2004 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Run camm Web-Manager in cookieless mode
When camm Web-Manager runs in cookieless mode, then
all internal links track the SessionID per default (overwrite CalculateUrl method to get a custom behaviour)
it caches navigation items with an additional SessionID value in the primary key field
[adminsupport] 23.04.2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Use the integrated mail queue for sending e-mails
TripleState.Undefined is for auto-detection, use TripleState.False for direct sending without mail queue or TripleState.True for sending via mail queue
[AdminSupport] 04.05.2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Defines weather to put data in "Session" or in "Cache".
Reads set value from web.config. "True" indicates to use "Session" for holding data in memory, else hold data in "Http Cache"
[patil] 25.05.2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Every WebEditor content is related to a server; this property overrides the server ID value where to read from/save to
0 = currently used server; other values = forced server ID
[wezel] 14.01.2008 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Always regard the crawlers as an anonymous user
Based on the browser identification string, all browsers and also the crawlers are identifying themselves.
If one of these browsers identifies as an crawler, it can be mostly seen as an anonymous user. This helps saving unneeded roundtrips to the database for asking user account information and authorization states.
[adminsupport] 23.04.2005 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Recognize all database builds up to this number to be compatible with the current assembly version
In some situations, you update the camm Web-Manager database but still want to keep running an older version of the assembly in combination with the newer database version. This is possible, but not recommended. Do it on your own risk.
[adminwezel] 10.08.2007 Created
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------

The ServerGroupID is typically diffferent for intranet and extranet. By this setting complete cammWM.TextModule library will use the configured ServerGroupID for all loading/saving in methods with undefined server group ID

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
Default ServerGroupID for load/save of text modules
The ServerGroupID is typically diffferent for intranet and extranet. By this setting complete cammWM.TextModule library will always use the configured ServerGroupID for all loading/saving even if a parameter of a method defines a server group ID
[patil] 07.06.2006 Created

member.summary: Creates a junction link

member.name: M:CompuMaster.Tools.IO.Junctions.Delete(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes a link

member.name: M:CompuMaster.Tools.IO.Junctions.Delete(System.String,CompuMaster.Tools.IO.Junctions.LinkTypeDirectives)
member.summary: Deletes a given LinkType link

member.name: T:CompuMaster.Tools.IO.Junctions.LinkTypeDirectives
member.summary: None: Real file (copy) Auto: Automatic decision in following order: hard link, soft link, file link. HardLink: Also JunctionLinks, only available on local NTFS volumes, the NTFS does all the work. This technique is transparent to windows and all applications. SoftLink: Soft links are not .LNK files! They can appear in windows explorer as normal folders/files. Windows handles the soft links, not the files system. Applications may need to support soft links to use their full functionality. FileLink: File links are the well known .LNK files which you see in your windows start menu for example.

member.name: T:CompuMaster.Tools.IO.Junctions.LinkTypes
member.summary: HardLink: Also JunctionLinks, only available on local NTFS volumes, the NTFS does all the work. This technique is transparent to windows and all applications. SoftLink: Soft links are not .LNK files! They can appear in windows explorer as normal folders/files. Windows handles the soft links, not the files system. Applications may need to support soft links to use their full functionality. FileLink: File links are the well known .LNK files which you see in your windows start menu for example.

member.name: M:CompuMaster.Tools.IO.Junctions.GetFileSystem(System.String)
member.summary: GefFileSystem returns the file system type of root directory of the the given path (e. g. from D: instead of D:\temp\). This problematic behaviour should be fixed in a later version and should return the file system of the given path itself (to support volumes without drive letters in Win2K or newer and Linux, too).
member.param: Path to get the file system type of
member.returns: One of the following file system types: "NTFS", "" (for any unknown/unsupported file systems)

Returns different information on all the users matching the filter expression within the given domain as contents of a DataTable
The Table contains the following columns: - UserName User's accountname - FirstName First name - LastName Last name - DiplayName Diplayed name - Title Title - EMail E-Mail address - Phone Phone number - MobilePhone Cell / mobile phone number - VoIPPhone VoIP phone number - Street Street and house number - ZIP Zip / postal code - City City name - Country Country name - Company Company name - Department Department name - Initials The initials of the user
